entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 28 at 7:01AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Higher than normal water levels in creeks and streams in Inyo County through the Memorial Day Weekend... entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 12:00PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on a snowpack will continue to accelerate runoff due to snowmelt. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and are expected to remain above bankfull through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 9:55PM MDT until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 11:13AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt has been slowing the past few days and water levels on Pacific Creek near Moran have been on a similar slow decline. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:44AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues the Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Sweetwater and Lincoln Counties. .Snowmelt continues in the higher elevations of the Wyoming Range. Tributary creeks and streams are still running high, which will

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:38AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Temperatures remain warm enough to allow for mountain snowpack to continue melting in the higher elevations of the Salt River Range. Tributary creeks and streams feeding the Salt River will continue to run high, but water levels are gradually lowering. Low-lying areas

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:28AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Temperatures remain warm enough to allow for mountain snowpack to continue melting in the surrounding mountains. Tributary creeks and streams feeding the Bear River will keep the river above flood stage
